summary_points: 1. Charter added 514,000 mobile lines in Q1 2025, while internet and video customer losses decreased compared to the same period last year.
2.  Charter repurchased $802 million of its Class A common stock in Q1 2025, and as of March 31, 2025, had $2.7 billion of remaining share repurchase authority.
3. Charter incurred a $90 million impairment charge related to its Los Angeles Lakers regional sports network agreement in Q1 2025.
1. Fiserv's Q1 2025 net income increased by 16% year-over-year, reaching $116 million more than Q1 2024, primarily due to higher processing revenue.
2. Fiserv acquired Payfare Inc. and CCV Group B.V. in March 2025 for a total of $324 million.
3. Fiserv anticipates approximately $16 million in losses over the next year (from April 25, 2025) related to foreign exchange and interest rate hedging contracts.
1. Alphabet Inc. acquired Wiz for $32 billion, an all-cash transaction expected to close in 2026.
2.  Alphabet repurchased $15.3 billion of its shares in Q1 2025 and authorized a further $70 billion repurchase program in April 2025.
3. Alphabet has $17.3 billion in future lease payments for data centers commencing between 2025 and 2031.
1. Centene Corp.'s managed care membership declined by 479,000 (2%) year-over-year as of March 31, 2025, while total revenues increased 15% to $46.6 billion for Q1 2025.
2. Centene anticipates $1.6 billion in net cash from dividends and capital expenditures ($615 million) for the remainder of 2025.

3.  As of March 5, 2025, Centene Corp. secured a new credit agreement with a $4 billion revolving credit facility and a $2 billion term loan, maturing March 5, 2030, subject to a quarterly debt-to-capital ratio covenant.
1. Republic Services acquired $826 million in environmental services businesses in Q1 2025, and plans to invest a further $1 billion in acquisitions throughout the year.

2.  Despite a 3.8% year-over-year revenue increase in Q1 2025, this was driven by increased yield, offsetting a volume decrease; the company also expects $10 million in restructuring charges in the remainder of 2025.

3.  Republic Services is contesting liability for $392 million in remediation costs at the West Lake Landfill Superfund site as of April 25, 2025, and had $62 million in outstanding borrowings as of March 31, 2025.
1. Intel recorded a $2.8 billion non-cash goodwill impairment charge in Q3 2025, primarily impacting Mobileye.
2. Intel's Q1 2025 net income was -$887 million, a significant year-over-year decrease.
3. Intel's 2024 Restructuring Plan, expected to be complete by Q4 2025, incurred a cumulative cost of $2.9 billion as of April 25, 2025.
1. Southwest Airlines reported a $149 million net loss in Q1 2025, a 35.5% year-over-year decrease despite record operating revenues.
2.  The airline projects flat to down 4% year-over-year unit revenue in Q2 2025, despite a 1-2% capacity increase, due to inflationary pressures increasing operating expenses by 3.5-5.5%.
3.  Southwest discontinued its fuel hedging program in Q1 2025 and doesn't plan to reinstate it before 2028.
1. Rollins, Inc. completed four acquisitions totaling $28.9 million in Q1 2025.
2. Rollins, Inc.'s Q1 2025 revenue increased 9.9% year-over-year to $822.5 million, despite a negative impact from currency fluctuations.
3. Rollins, Inc. anticipates a significant increase in interest expense in 2025, projecting $8-10 million for Q2 alone.
1. Verisign's .com and .net domain name registrations decreased by 1.5% year-over-year to 169.8 million as of March 31, 2025.
2.  Verisign refinanced $500 million in debt, replacing notes due April 1, 2025 with new notes due June 1, 2032.
3. As of March 31, 2025, Verisign had $792.7 million remaining available under its authorized common stock repurchase program.

1. Charter Communications, Inc. reported a first-quarter 2025 revenue of $13.7 billion, a 0.4% year-over-year increase primarily driven by residential mobile service revenue growth of 33.5%, residential Internet revenue growth of 1.8%, and other revenue growth of 13.4%.
2.  First-quarter 2025 free cash flow increased to $1.6 billion, a significant jump from $358 million in the first quarter of 2024.

3. Charter anticipates full-year 2025 capital expenditures to reach approximately $12 billion, contingent on several factors including network evolution and expansion, supply chain timing, and growth in residential and commercial sectors.

1. LyondellBasell Industries N.V. reported a net income of $177 million for the quarter ended March 31, 2025, which was $0.21 per share higher than it would have been excluding identified items like exit costs from closing a Dutch joint venture.
2.  Compared to the same period in 2024, EBITDA decreased by $400 million, primarily due to planned and unplanned maintenance and higher energy costs.
3. LyondellBasell announced a $500 million Cash Improvement Plan to address macroeconomic volatility and strengthen financial results, indicating concern about continued industry downturn.

1. Aon plc reported 16% total revenue growth for the quarter ended March 31, 2025, driven by the contribution from NFP, 5% organic revenue growth, and a 2% unfavorable impact from foreign currency translation.
2.  Free cash flow decreased significantly year-over-year in Q1 2025, falling from $261 million to $84 million, a 68% decrease.
3. The company expects an unfavorable impact on adjusted EPS of approximately $0.08 per share for the full year 2025 due to foreign currency translation if current rates remain stable.
1. Centene Corp's Q1 2025 adjusted diluted EPS was $2.90, a 28% year-over-year increase from Q1 2024.
2.  As of April 25th, 2025, Centene increased its 2025 premium and service revenue guidance by $6.0 billion, primarily due to Marketplace enrollment outperformance and Medicare Advantage retention.
3. Centene secured a five-year (with a two-year extension option) Medicaid managed care contract in Nevada, starting January 2026, and also won a contract for the state's Marketplace public option.
1. On April 24, 2025, IQVIA Holdings Inc. amended its Certificate of Incorporation to exculpate certain officers from liability and remove obsolete provisions related to its board structure.

2. At the 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (record date February 24, 2025),  a proposal concerning special stockholder meetings received significantly more "against" votes (86,013,439) than "for" votes (66,155,724).
3.  The appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as IQVIA's independent registered public accounting firm for the year ending December 31, 2025, was ratified by stockholders.
1. At Eaton Corporation plc's April 23, 2025 Annual General Meeting, all shareholder proposals were approved.
2.  The election of twelve director nominees saw significant variation in "Against" votes, ranging from 774,162 to 19,543,678.
3. Proposal 3, advisory approval of executive compensation, received 285,077,494 "For" votes and 20,710,365 "Against" votes, indicating some shareholder dissent regarding executive pay.
